that Herr Hitler

-Not a chance. -So this is it?

What do the gentlemen plan on doing?

Show him the proof.

All right.

translation.en: -Yes. -[laughs]
Oh, Paul?

translation.en: This is different.

Thanks.
[in English] Sir Alexander? I got a message you wanted to see me.

see some bigots and perverts?

Herr von Hartmann, that's a great honour.

-Frau Winter. -Frau Winter.
Anyway, the English and the French aren't staying for dinner.
They've lost their appetite.
-So we were asked to fill the ranks. -[man] Dr. Schmidt!
translation.ko: - 그래서 우리가 초대된 거지 - 슈미트 박사!

translation.en: Well, looks like I'm needed again.
-[in English] A narrow escape. -Thank you.
The Führer is vegetarian. Insists on meat not being served anywhere.
translation.ko: 총통은 채식주의자예요 고기를 내놓는 법이 없죠

translation.en: -Does he? -Yes.
When I was at lunch at the Chancellery with all the high command,
translation.ko: 총통 관저에서 고관들과 식사한 적이 있는데

translation.en: -they served Sellerieschnitzel. -[snorts]
-Musso will have enjoyed that. -Yes, wouldn't he just?
And afterward, I'm telling you, I went to a butcher's shop nearby.
translation.ko: 그렇게 먹은 다음 근처에 있는 정육점에 가서는

translation.en: -Ordered two huge sausages. -Could be Wurst.
Yes. And I was just leaving the butcher's shop,
when who should be coming in but Hermann Göring,
-with a hungry look on his face? -[laughing]
-He was as famished as I was. -Sir, I--
translation.ko: - 나만큼 속이 허했던 거예요 - 윌슨 경

translation.en: Yes, not now, Legat.
[in German] Don't drink too much, von Hartmann. Just wet your lips.
We still have a lot of work ahead of us.
Tomorrow, the world will watch Munich and our translations.
translation.ko: 내일 전 세계가 뮌헨과 우리의 번역문을 보게 될 걸세

translation.en: Of course.
We can't afford any mistakes.
…he has some skill. He's not a bad negotiator.
translation.ko: 협상 기술은 있더군 그리 나쁘지 않았어

translation.en: [Henderson, in English] Prime Minister, tomorrow morning,
millions of mothers will be blessing you
for having saved their sons from the horror of war.
Oh…
-Prime Minister. -[Chamberlain] Too kind.
-Can I have a word? -Not now.
-It's rather urgent. -Legat!
You really should go and rest before the signing, Neville.
I think I will take forty winks.
-I sent a sandwich up to your room. -Thanks so much, Horace.
Legat. Will you just give the man a moment to breathe?
-Yes. -He's very tired.
He's been up for 15 hours or more.
Yes, sir. Sorry.
Join us for supper.
All right.
-[in German] Excuse me. -Von Hartmann?
Where are you going?
Excuse me, my Führer. I'm needed for the translation of the agreement.
translation.ko: 죄송합니다, 총통님 협약 번역문을 보러 가야 합니다

translation.en: Come here.
I never forget a personal obligation.
translation.ko: 난 개인적인 의무를 절대 잊지 않네

translation.en: For Germany,
I am prepared to be dishonest a thousand times over.
translation.ko: 수천 번도 더 부정해질 준비가 되어 있지만

translation.en: For myself, never.
I'm no watch thief.
Thank you, my Führer.
[Himmler] To the good health of our dear Italian friends.
translation.ko: 우리 이탈리아 동지들의 건강을 위해 건배하시죠

translation.en: And to the Führer.
[all] To the Führer.
[Wilson, in English] One of the Italian delegates was saying how good the kitchen is.
translation.ko: 이탈리아 대표 말이 여기 음식이 참 훌륭하다더군요

translation.en: -[Henderson] Yes, indeed, yes. -[Wilson] What do you recommend?
-[Henderson] I recommend the Hachsen. -[Wilson] What is that?
[Henderson] It's a pork knuckle. Very crispy.
-Sir Horace! -Yes?
Would you mind if I joined you in a moment?
Yes, of course.
-Have you read it? -It's classified.
-If they find… -Have you spoken to Chamberlain?
-Have you spoken to Chamberlain? -Keep your voice down!
translation.ko: - 들키기라도 하면… - 체임벌린한테 말은 해봤어? 목소리 낮춰, 아직이야

translation.en: -Thre's no linen. No linen. -[Hugh] Not yet.
You know they're about to sign?
It isn't an easy thing to raise with him.
-Then I'll do it. -Oh, for God's sake! Don't be stupid.
translation.ko: - 그럼 내가 하지 - 바보 같은 소리 마

translation.en: This is the last moment. Do you understand?
I won't have it on my conscience that I did nothing!
translation.ko: 손 놓고 있었다는 양심의 가책은 사절이야

translation.en: -I feel the same. As soon as I can-- -No, no.
-I'll talk to him. -Not soon, now!
translation.ko: 마찬가지야, 최대한 빨리 말해볼게 - 지금! 같이 가자 - 안 돼

translation.en: -Let's do it together. -No!
-Why not? We are on the edge. -Do you have any idea--
translation.ko: - 왜? - 이게 얼마나… 더는 방법이 없어

translation.en: We are right on the edge.
Paul.
-I'm sorry. -What's happened to you?
We have to try, Hugh.
Please, we have to try.
This'll be the end of my career.
Where's the document?
In my room.
Come on.
[secretary] Is there another hotel nearby?
Downtown. I will call it. I will call.
Thank you, that would be great.
In the meantime, if we can get some linen so we can have a shower, that would be amazing.
translation.ko: 그동안 샤워할 수 있게 수건을 갖다주면 좋겠어요

translation.en: Listen.
He's old, and he's exhausted.
translation.ko: 총리님은 연세도 많으시고 지금 많이 피곤하셔

translation.en: I'll give him the document, and if he agrees to see you,
translation.ko: 내가 문서를 드릴 거야 총리님이 널 보자시면

translation.en: for God's sake, don't give him a moral lecture.
translation.ko: 제발 윤리니 뭐니 가르치려 들지 마

translation.en: -Just the facts. -All right.
Wait here.
Oh, sorry, Prime Minister.
No, no, no, no. Come on in, Legat. Just having my blood pressure checked.
translation.ko: 아니, 들어오게 그냥 혈압 체크 중이야

translation.en: Fortunately, it looks as if I'll live another day.
translation.ko: 다행히 하루 더 살 수 있을 것 같군

translation.en: -Good night. -Good night, Joseph. Thank you.
translation.ko: - 편안한 밤 되십시오 - 잘 가게, 조지프, 고마워

translation.en: So what is it that can't wait? Hm?
We've come into possession of a significant document.
And who is "we"?
I have come into possession of a document.
What is it?
The minutes of a meeting that Hitler held with his senior commanders last November.
translation.ko: 지난 11월, 히틀러와 독일 고위 간부 회의록입니다

translation.en: A meeting in which he explicitly commits himself to a war of conquest.
translation.ko: 정복 전쟁에 전념하리라는 히틀러의 선언이 들어 있죠

translation.en: Obviously, it's all in German,
translation.ko: 물론 독일어로 되어 있지만 정식 문서가 분명합니다

translation.en: but I believe it to be legitimate and truthful.
translation.ko: 물론 독일어로 되어 있지만 정식 문서가 분명합니다 위조되지 않았어요

translation.en: And how did this document come to us?
A friend gave it to me in strict confidence.
translation.ko: 제 친구가 확신을 가지고 저한테 넘겼습니다

translation.en: -Friend? -A German diplomat.
Why does he wish us to have it?
I think he should explain that himself. He's waiting outside.
translation.ko: 그 친구가 직접 말씀드릴 겁니다 밖에서 기다리고 있어요

translation.en: -Does Sir Horace know about this? -No, sir.
Nobody knows.
You're exceeding your authority, young man.
[scoffs] I can't possibly meet with a German diplomat.
I understand, but he is risking his life to see you.
translation.ko: 말씀은 알겠습니다만 그 친구는 목숨을 걸고 왔습니다

translation.en: No…
This is… most improper.
I'm aware, sir.
Right.
Three minutes. Not a moment longer.
You've got three minutes.
This is Paul von Hartmann of the German Foreign Ministry.
-How do you do? -Thank you for seeing me.
I'm not sure it's very wise. For either of us.
translation.ko: 좋은 생각이 아닐세 우리 둘 모두에게 말이야

translation.en: Take a seat. Close the door, Legat.
You better come and join us, Legat. Come on.
So, get on with it.
That document is proof that Hitler is lying
translation.ko: 그 문서는 히틀러가 거짓말을 한다는 증거입니다

translation.en: when he claims to have no further territorial demands.
translation.ko: 영토에 대한 요구는 이것으로 끝나지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: On the contrary, he wants to expand the country,
translation.ko: 오히려 히틀러는 국토 확장에 대한 욕심이 많습니다

translation.en: and he will keep on expanding.
Therefore, I beg you not to sign the agreement tonight.
translation.ko: 그러니 부디 오늘 밤 협정에 서명하지 마십시오

translation.en: [laughing] What?
Prime Minister.
Adolf Hitler is a monster.
He is a madman.
You cannot give him what he wants. He'll take more and more land.
translation.ko: 원하는 걸 주시면 안 됩니다 그는 더 많은 땅을 탐낼 거고

translation.en: More and more people will suffer.
That is the proof.
I applaud your courage, young man.
But I have to give you a lesson in political reality.
translation.ko: 하지만 정치 현실에 대해 알아야 할 점이 있어

translation.en: The people of Great Britain will never take up arms over a local border dispute.
translation.ko: 고작 지역 분쟁 때문에 영국이 무기를 드는 일은 없을 걸세

translation.en: -It's so much more than a local border-- -As for what Hitler may do
translation.ko: - 고작 지역 분쟁이 아니라… - 앞으로… 히틀러가 어떻게 나올지는 두고 봐야 아는 일이지

translation.en: or may not do in the future, well, we shall have to wait and see.
translation.ko: 히틀러가 어떻게 나올지는 두고 봐야 아는 일이지

translation.en: -Wait and see is not-- -My sole objective here
translation.ko: 두고 보는 것만으로는… 나의 유일한 목표는 지금 당장 전쟁을 막아

translation.en: is to avert war in the immediate term,
translation.ko: 나의 유일한 목표는 지금 당장 전쟁을 막아

translation.en: so I can begin to build a lasting peace.
-There will be no lasting peace. -But I have to try!
Look, the worst thing I could do is to walk away from this conference.
translation.ko: 지금 회담을 포기하는 건 말도 안 되는 짓이야

translation.en: If you do, there are people waiting, high up in the military,
translation.ko: 그렇게 해주시면 군 고위 간부들이 나설 겁니다

translation.en: a resistance, to bring him down.
-Well, why haven't they done so already? -They will if--
translation.ko: - 진작 안 하고 왜 지금? - 상황만 허락…

translation.en: I can't rely on some resistance
you may believe exists in the German army.
translation.ko: 독일군 내부에 그런 게 실재하는지도 모르겠고

translation.en: Well, I…
think you should…
take this back to wherever it came from.
translation.ko: 이건 원래 있던 곳으로 돌려놓는 게 좋겠군

translation.en: No.
Keep it. Study it.
That is the political reality.
Now you're being impertinent.
And you are shaking hands with a man who hates everything you stand for!
translation.ko: 당신이 지지하는 모든 것을 증오하는 자와 손을 잡은 겁니다

translation.en: He is lying to you. He will go further and further.
translation.ko: 그는 거짓을 말하고 있어요 앞으로 더한 일을 벌일 겁니다

translation.en: He will not stop, sir. He will never sto--
Thank you for your time.
Please don't sign the agreement.
Get rid of this.
I have to say, Legat,
I'm extremely disappointed in you.
[in French] Mr. President of the Council.
-Yes? -Thank you for your cooperation.
I think we have come to a very good agreement.
-[in English] Prime Minister. -[Chamberlain] Ah. Nice to see you.
Oh, Monsieur Daladier. Did you get some dinner?
[in German] There they are.
…the Czechs aren't here, given the circumstances.
translation.ko: 상황이 여의치 않아 체코는 오지 못했습니다

translation.en: Um… Oh, there's Monsieur Daladier. I want to--
[in French] Mr. Daladier, how was your dinner?
-[in English] Sorry, we we both speaking. -[Chamberlain] Um, um… un sandwich?
-À tout à l'heure. -[man] It is very exciting…
[in German] Are you looking for someone?
Yes, thank you. About the arrangements for the press?
Who's responsible for that?
Enjoy the rest of your stay in Munich, Mr. Legat.
[in English] Oh bloody hell.
[in German] What did you want from him?
Can a British photographer be at the signing?
translation.ko: 영국 사진 기사가 서명식에 들어갈 수 있어?

translation.en: No chance.
Only the Führer's personal photographer has permission to take pictures.
translation.ko: 총통의 개인 사진사만 사진을 찍을 수 있지

translation.en: [in English] I'm sorry if I embarrassed you tonight.
I'm the one who should apologise.
What have you done with the document?
I will take it to London, find a more responsive audience.
translation.ko: 런던으로 가져가서 들어줄 사람을 찾을 거야

translation.en: It won't be a waste.
-[man, in German] Gentlemen! -We should stop talking.
[Schmidt, in English] The Führer is pleased to invite you back to the library for the signing ceremony.
translation.ko: 서재에서 있을 서명식에 총통께서 여러분을 초대합니다

translation.en: -Prime Minister. -[Chamberlain] Good.
Duce, Monsieur Président du Conseil, Excellencies, gentlemen.
translation.ko: 이탈리아 수령님, 프랑스 총리님 대사님들, 관계자 여러분

translation.en: Please, this way.
Who's there?
[Paul] Open the door.
I want to show you something.
Now?
It's the only time we have.
Give me two minutes.
[Paul] You can talk to her.
She won't respond, but maybe she can hear.
translation.ko: 대답은 못 하지만 들을 수 있을지도 몰라

translation.en: Lena?
[in German] It's me, Hugh.
[in English] What happened?
We split up.
After your trip to Munich.
How did she end up here?
She was arrested at a protest in '35
and sent to Moringen, the women's camp.
When they discovered she was Jewish…
they were rough.
They said she fell out of a window.
I'm sure she did.
But not before they carved a Star of David onto her back.
translation.ko: 놈들이 레나 등에 다윗의 별을 새겼거든

translation.en: I knew he was racist.
All the awful Jewish stuff, I thought it could be put to one side.
translation.ko: 유대인에게 행한 그 만행들 무시할 수 있을 줄 알았지

translation.en: How?
But you can't put it aside.
If they are capable of that, they are capable of anything.
translation.ko: 저런 짓을 할 수 있다면 놈들은 뭐든 할 수 있게 되니까

translation.en: Lena knew that.
Yes, she did.
May I?
Shall we share?
What will you do?
Carry on.
In a few hours, I have to present a press summary to Hitler.
translation.ko: 몇 시간 후에 히틀러한테 외신 브리핑을 하기로 했어

translation.en: I'm told he's taken a shine to me.
Maybe it's a chance to really do something.
What do you…
-How? -It would solve everything.
translation.ko: - 어떻게? - 그럼 모든 게 해결될 거야

translation.en: They'd kill you for even thinking about it.
I have a pistol.
I might get a moment alone with him.
Stop it!
Don't be stupid.
I'll take the document to London. It will make a difference.
translation.ko: 문서를 런던으로 가져갈게 상황이 달라질 거야

translation.en: Probably more talking, yes.
-Yes, more talking. -I have to fight.
You don't have to fight!
We don't choose the times we live in.
The only choice we have is how we respond.
translation.ko: 선택할 수 있는 건 우리의 행동뿐이지

translation.en: -You don't have to fight, Paul! We don't. -I have to fight.
translation.ko: - 싸울 필요 없어 - 난… - 싸움이 아니라 대화를 해야지 - 난 싸워야만 해!

translation.en: -We need to talk! We need to-- -I… have to fight!
translation.ko: - 싸움이 아니라 대화를 해야지 - 난 싸워야만 해!

translation.en: -No, you don't! No! -No! It's my responsibility! Understand?
translation.ko: - 아니, 안 돼! - 아니, 이건 내 책임이야! 이해 못 하겠어?

translation.en: -Your responsibility? -Or I may as well blow my brains out.
There are other ways of doing things! Talk, discussion--
-There's no other things, no. -There's always hope!
translation.ko: - 다른 길은 없어 - 언제나 희망은 있어

translation.en: [sighs] Hoping is waiting for someone else to do it.
translation.ko: 희망은 남이 나서주길 기다리는 것밖에 안 돼

translation.en: We'd all be much better off without it.
translation.ko: 그런 건 차라리 없는 게 나아

translation.en: I'd miss you.
Goodbye.
Goodbye.
REGINA PALACE HOTEL
-Hello. -Hello.
Bit early for a walk.
Yes.
I-- I couldn't sleep. I had to clear my head.
Are you all right?
-Why are you standing out here? -I'm looking for you.
translation.ko: - 왜 여기 서 계세요? - 당신을 찾고 있었어요

translation.en: The PM's awake, and he wants to see you.
-I heard you were looking for me, sir. -Ah! Legat. Good morning.
Don't suppose you brought that copy of The Times with…
with Hitler's speech in it, did you?
Yes, sir. I put it in your box, sir.
Oh, good man. Can you find it for me?
Had a word with him last night.
Asked if I might see him again this morning before we fly back.
translation.ko: 돌아가기 전 아침에 내가 잠깐 만나자고 했지

translation.en: -[Hugh] Asked who, sir? -Herr Hitler.
Did-- did he agree?
[chuckles] Couldn't really refuse.
Must say, that was a remarkably rude young man you brought to see me last night.
translation.ko: 어젯밤에 날 만나러 온 청년은 정말이지 무례하더군

translation.en: -I really am sorry about that, sir. -Ah, thank you.
-Have you told anyone about it? -No.
translation.ko: - 아무한테도 말 안 했나? - 안 했습니다

translation.en: Good. Neither have I.
His arguments were naive,
but… they were not ineffective.
Now, here we are.
Listen, I'd like you to take this to Wilson.
Ask him to turn it into a short statement of intent.
Just from there to there.
Sir, I don't follow.
Well, on Monday night, Hitler publicly declared his desire
for a permanent peace between Germany and Great Britain.
-Yes. -Well, I'd like his undertaking redrafted.
translation.ko: - 그렇군요 - 그 뜻을 살려 다시 쓰려는 거야

translation.en: -In the form of a joint statement. -A joint statement?
translation.ko: - 공동 성명서의 형태로 말이지 - 공동 성명서요?

translation.en: To which both he and I can put our names this morning.
translation.ko: 나와 히틀러의 이름을 오늘 아침에 함께 적어 넣는 거지

translation.en: Oh, get on with it. Go on. Get it done.
And get yourself a coffee. You're half awake.
translation.ko: 커피도 좀 마시고 비몽사몽 하는 얼굴이군

translation.en: "We regard the agreement signed last night
as symbolic of the desire of our two peoples
translation.ko: '우리 두 나라가 서로를 상대로 다시는 전쟁하지 않겠다는'

translation.en: never to go to war with one another again."
I hope the PM realises this has no legal force whatsoever.
translation.ko: 법적 효력이 없다는 걸 총리님이 아셨으면 좋겠군요

translation.en: -The man's not a fool. -What the hell's he playing at?
translation.ko: - 사람을 무슨 바보로 보시나 - 그럼 이게 뭐 하는 짓이죠?

translation.en: I've no idea. First I heard of it was half an hour ago.
-Do you have it? -[Wilson] Yes.
-Good. -It may be a little long.
-What if he refuses to sign it? -[Chamberlain] Why should he?
These are all statements he's made already.
[Wilson] It doesn't mean he's going to stick with them.
It's symbolic, Horace.
Last night's agreement only settles a tiny dispute.
translation.ko: 어젯밤 협정으로 해결한 건 사소한 분쟁에 불과해

translation.en: There will be others.
And I want him to publicly commit himself to peace.
translation.ko: 난 히틀러가 공개적으로 평화를 선언했으면 해

translation.en: Oh, Legat, make sure there's a car available at 11:00.
To the Führerbau?
No. Ah, you've put my name before his. It should be the other way around.
translation.ko: 아니, 내 이름을 먼저 썼군 거꾸로 되어야지

translation.en: Otherwise, good.
Yes, I wanted to have a private meeting with him.
Man to man, no officials.
-He invited me to his apartment. -What?
-No officials? -Not even you, Horace.
translation.ko: - 두 분만요? - 자네도 안 돼, 호러스

translation.en: Oh, for God's sake. You can't go and see Hitler entirely on your own.
translation.ko: 세상에, 총리님 혼자 히틀러를 만나실 순 없어요

translation.en: Can and will.
translation.ko: 할 수 있고 그렇게 할 거네

translation.en: Gentlemen, we must rise to the level of events.
What? Hey!
[in German] What are you doing here?
I mean, what the hell are you doing here in Munich?
What are you doing here in Munich? What's going on here?
translation.ko: 무슨 꿍꿍이지? 뭐가 어떻게 돼가는 거야?

translation.en: What is going on here? Talk to me!
I don't know--
Now, let's talk. Come on. Talk to me!
I would suggest you go back where you came from.
translation.ko: 원래 있던 곳으로 얌전히 돌아가는 게 좋을 거다

translation.en: Legat. [spits]
Paul.
[Chamberlain] It was a specific point.
A bit of an embarrassment. Well, why was there…
[Wilson] With respect to-- There just is. I can't explain it any more.
translation.ko: 외람되지만 그냥 그런 겁니다 더는 설명할 수가 없어요

translation.en: -Prime Minister? -Yes?
-I should accompany you to the meeting. -No.
translation.ko: - 총리님과 함께 가고 싶습니다 - 안 돼

translation.en: I thought I had made this perfectly clear. No officials.
translation.ko: 분명히 말했잖나 보좌관 없이 갈 거라고

translation.en: Not as an official, sir. As a translator.
No, I want him to feel this is a personal meeting.
translation.ko: 아니, 사적인 만남이라는 느낌을 주고 싶어

translation.en: You need someone there to make sure your words are accurately reported.
translation.ko: 총리님의 말씀을 전달할 사람이 필요하실 겁니다

translation.en: -I-- -Remember what happened at Berchtesgaden
-when he refused to give us a copy… -No, that--
translation.ko: 히틀러가 대화록을 넘기지 않아 어떻게 됐는지요

translation.en: You can't trust Schmidt to have your back.
I think a translator could be useful.
-I'm the only one who speaks German. -All right, all right, all right!
translation.ko: 독일어를 할 줄 아는 사람은 우리 중 저뿐이고요 그래, 알았네!

translation.en: You can come, but be discreet.
Keep out of his eyeline. And mine.
translation.ko: 히틀러의 눈에 띄지 마 내 눈에도

translation.en: -[reporters clamouring] -Mr. Chamberlain!
-Mr. Chamberlain! -Mr. Chamberlain!
[man] Good morning, Prime Minister.
-This way, sir. -Morning.
-[officer] Your wardrobe. -[whispers] They have the document.
-[Schmidt] Good morning. -[Chamberlain] Good morning.
-[Schmidt] Did you sleep well? -[Chamberlain] Very well.
[Schmidt] I'm pleased to hear that, sir.
[Chamberlain] We, the German Führer and British Prime Minister,
are agreed in respect of the future of Anglo-German relations.
We regard the agreement signed last night
as symbolic of the desire of our two peoples
translation.ko: '우리 두 나라가 서로를 상대로 다시는 전쟁하지 않겠다는'

translation.en: never to go to war with one another again.
We are determined to continue to remove possible sources of difference
and to contribute to the peace of Europe.
[in English] Prime Minister, I would like to thank you explicitly.
[Schmidt, in English] I will accompany you back to your hotel.
Thank you, Herr Hitler.
And may I add
that there was never a doubt in my mind, sir,
translation.ko: 전 한 번도 의심한 적이 없습니다

translation.en: as to the lengths to which you would go to protect Germany.
translation.ko: 총통께서 독일을 지키기 위해 어디까지 가실 것인지 말입니다

translation.en: [officer, in German] The foreign press summary!
[in English] Thank you. Come along, Legat.
[man, in German] The Reichsführer is arriving.
Please excuse me, my Führer.
[Hitler] "The cheers for Hitler were mechanical and polite."
"For Chamberlain, they were ecstatic."
You, as an educated German, what do you think? Are they right?
translation.ko: 배울 만큼 배운 독일인으로서 어떻게 생각하나? 맞는 말인가?

translation.en: I do not wish to be followed mechanically!
I gave Germany back its dignity.
Is it too much to ask for a little gratitude?
"Mechanical."
They're grateful to this arsehole Chamberlain!
Am I the only one who realises that we have a historic task ahead of us?
translation.ko: 우리 앞에 주어진 역사적 임무를 이해하는 사람은 정말 나뿐인가?

translation.en: That this is the moment for Germany to fulfil its destiny?
translation.ko: 지금은 독일이 그 운명을 완수하는 순간이란 말이야

translation.en: Speak. I want you to answer me.
Why aren't they grateful?
The people don't want a war. They're afraid.
translation.ko: 국민은 전쟁을 원치 않습니다 두려워하고 있어요

translation.en: The people don't know what they want.
They're children.
But you're right. They are afraid.
I am surrounded by cowardice.
Yes, my Führer.
I told you, I can read people.
translation.ko: 말했듯이 난 사람을 읽을 줄 아네

translation.en: You say yes,
but your eyes…
are saying no.
It's just you and I here.
So…
what are you thinking, von Hartmann?
What do you…
want to say to me?
Nothing.
Heil, my Führer.
I'm told you've signed another agreement with Chamberlain?
Don't take that so seriously. That piece of paper is of no significance.
translation.ko: 진지하게 받아들일 것 없네 그깟 종이 쪼가리 별 의미 없어

translation.en: The problem lies here, with the German people.
Anything else?
Thank you.
For…
this.
Thank you.
[in English] I hope you don't mind. They asked me to share a ride to the airport.
I'm glad to have a moment alone with you.
I haven't been altogether straight with you.
No?
No. I'm actually something of a guardian angel.
What on earth are you talking about?
In London, you asked my surname.
It's Menzies.
I think you know my uncle. He's a colonel in the Foreign Office.
translation.ko: 제 삼촌을 아실 겁니다 외무부 대령이시죠

translation.en: Well, he asked me to keep an eye on you out here.
Thank goodness I did.
I took it from your room last night when you went off with your friend.
translation.ko: 어젯밤 친구 만나러 가셨을 때 당신 방에서 가져왔어요

translation.en: I think other parties were trying to find it this morning?
translation.ko: 오늘 아침에 보니까 누가 또 이걸 찾던데요?

translation.en: [in German] I assume you're waiting for me?
No, actually.
No?
Not today, Paulie. Not today, but soon. Very soon.
translation.ko: 오늘은 아니야, 파울리 오늘은 아니지만 곧 잡으러 가지

translation.en: Well, then.
-My regards-- -Get out.
[in English] Thank you.
Thank you, thank you.
Thank you, thank you, thank you.
-Thank-- -Enough!
Smoke?
Yes.
[Wilson] Sir.
Sir, we'll be on the ground in half an hour.
My God, I… fell asleep. Ooh.
Apparently, there's quite a crowd.
The King has asked you to go direct to Buckingham Palace
so their Majesties can thank you in person.
Oh, God.
I shall have to speak to the cameras.
The world doesn't yet know about our joint statement.
translation.ko: 세상은 아직 우리의 공동 성명서에 대해 몰라

translation.en: Prime Minister, I urge you
translation.ko: 총리님 히틀러가 한 약속은 신중하게 생각하셔야 합니다

translation.en: to treat the undertaking given by Hitler with the utmost caution.
translation.ko: 히틀러가 한 약속은 신중하게 생각하셔야 합니다

translation.en: -Ah… -The agreement on the Sudetenland
translation.ko: 수데테란트에 관한 협정과 오늘 서명한 합의는 별개…

translation.en: -is one thing, but this other document-- -Yes, I know. Horace, look.
translation.ko: 수데테란트에 관한 협정과 오늘 서명한 합의는 별개… 그래, 나도 알아 호러스

translation.en: If there's one thing I've learned from my dealings with Mr. Hitler,
translation.ko: 히틀러와 거래하며 배운 게 하나 있네

translation.en: it's that you can't play poker with a gangster without any cards up your sleeve.
translation.ko: 소매에 카드를 숨기지 않고는 깡패와 포커할 수 없다는 거야

translation.en: What if he breaks his word? You'll look like a fool.
translation.ko: 히틀러가 약속을 어기면요? 총리님만 바보가 될 겁니다

translation.en: Well, if he breaks his word, the world will see him for who he truly is!
translation.ko: 그래, 히틀러가 약속을 깨면 그가 어떤 인간인지 세상이 알게 되겠지

translation.en: And it'll unite the Allies. Might even bring the Americans on board.
translation.ko: 연합군이 힘을 모을 거야 미국이 참전할 수도 있지

translation.en: And if I'm made to look a fool, well, it's a small price to pay.
translation.ko: 내가 바보로 보이는 일쯤은 감당할 수 있어

translation.en: Horace, I can only play the game with the cards I've been dealt.
translation.ko: 난 내가 가진 카드로만 게임을 할 수 있네

translation.en: What do you think, Legat? Do you think this will change the game?
translation.ko: 어떤가, 레가트? 이걸로 판이 바뀔 것 같나?

translation.en: I think there's a chance, Prime Minister.
So do I.
[Wilson] Look at that, Legat.
You'd think we won a war rather than avoided one.
translation.ko: 전쟁을 피한 게 아니라 이겼다고 생각하겠지

translation.en: There are thousands of people gathering on the Mall.
translation.ko: 궁 앞 대로에는 수천 명이 모여 있어

translation.en: Welcome back, sir. Congratulations.
[Wilson] The King intends to take him out onto the balcony.
The settlement of the Czechoslovakian problem,
which has been achieved…
…uh, is in my mind
merely a prelude to a larger settlement,
which, for all Europe,
may bring peace.
For this morning…
this morning I had another talk…
…with the German Chancellor Herr Hitler.
Here is the paper
which bears his name upon it as well as mine.
translation.ko: 히틀러와 제 이름이 적힌 종이가 있습니다

translation.en: -Hello. -[sighs]
-Hello. -Hello.
Where's Arthur?
[sniffles] He's in the garden. He'll be happy to see you.
translation.ko: 정원에 있어 당신을 보면 기뻐할 거야

translation.en: I'm sorry for the way I left.
And, uh…
I wanted to say…
you were right.
I have felt disappointed.
And it's my fault, not yours.
But there are some things I want to change.
I think I might resign from the service.
And do what?
When war comes, I need to be…
useful.
Don't laugh, but I think I might join the RAF.
translation.ko: 그렇구나 웃지 마, 공군에 입대하려고 해

translation.en: What about the treaty? I thought he just said that--
Just a delay. The PM's given us a chance of winning the damn thing when it happens.
translation.ko: 잠깐 미뤘을 뿐이야 전쟁의 승기를 잡을 수 있도록 총리님이 기회를 만드신 거지

translation.en: It's quite some service when you think about it.
But it's coming.
Sooner or later.
One day soon, we will have to fight. And we will have to win.
translation.ko: 언젠가 그날이 오면 우리는 싸워야 해 우리가 이겨야 해

translation.en: There must be something else that you can do.
translation.ko: 당신이 할 수 있는 다른 일이 있을 거야

translation.en: -More talks, negotiations-- -There's no other way.
Don't say that.
There's always hope.
Yes.
And we'd all be much better off without it.
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 건 차라리 없는 게 나아

translation.en: -[running] -[Arthur] Daddy!
Here. Come here. Up a squeak.
Oh, I've missed you.
[in German] I could have shot Hitler.
I was so close to him, I could smell his breath.
translation.ko: 너무 가까워서 입 냄새가 맡아질 정도였죠

translation.en: I could feel the gun in my hand.
But my hand wouldn't move.
Do you know why?
What would give me the right?
Do you want to keep going?
What other choice do we have?
They'll hang you for that one day.
I know.
-♪ Turn to promises… ♪ -[Lena, in English] I'll take it.
-♪ You dream of summer… ♪ -Oh, you speak Russian as well, right?
♪ Of hearing bluebells chime ♪ ♪ Your golden locks ♪ -♪ Drenched in moonlight… ♪ -[ball-goers cheering]
♪ As we watch the birds fly by ♪ ♪ Come dance with me ♪
translation.ko: "네빌 체임벌린은 거센 비판 속에 총리직을 사임했고"

translation.en: ♪ Into the dark blue night ♪
translation.ko: "네빌 체임벌린은 거센 비판 속에 총리직을 사임했고" "몇 달 후 사망했다"

translation.en: ♪ Into the dark blue night ♪
translation.ko: "뮌헨 협정으로 시간을 번 덕에" "영국과 동맹국들은 전쟁에 대비할 수 있었고"

translation.en: ♪ You dream of summer ♪
